al6utils
Class Math

java.lang.Object
  al6utils.Math

public class Math
extends java.lang.Object

Utility class providing methods implementing math routines that are not available in java.lang.Math.

Method Summary
static double ceil(double x, double unit)
          Returns the smallest double value that is larger than the specified value and is equal to a multiple of the specified rounding unit.
static double floor(double x, double unit)
          Returns the largest double value that is smaller than the specified value and is equal to a multiple of the specified rounding unit.
static double median(double[] list, boolean sorted)
          Returns the median of an array of double values.
static java.lang.Double median(java.util.List<java.lang.Double> list, boolean sorted)
          Returns the median of a List array of Double values.
static double round(double x, double unit)
          Returns the double value that is closest to the specified value and is equal to a multiple of the specified rounding unit.
 
Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object
clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait
 

Method Detail

round

public static double round(double x,
                           double unit)

Returns the double value that is closest to the specified value and is equal to a multiple of the specified rounding unit. The java.lang.Math.round implementation allows rounding only to the nearest integer. It is equivalent to round(x, 1). The following table provides some examples:

xunitround(x, unit)
13.260.113.3
13.26312
13261001300
-13.261-13

Parameters:
x - value to be rounded
unit - rounding unit. Must be > 0.
Returns:
the rounded value

ceil

public static double ceil(double x,
                          double unit)

Returns the smallest double value that is larger than the specified value and is equal to a multiple of the specified rounding unit. The java.lang.Math.ceil implementation returns values that are multiples of integers only. It is equivalent to ceil(x, 1). The following table provides some examples:

xunitceil(x, unit)
13.260.113.3
13.26315
13261001400
-13.261-13

Parameters:
x - value whose ceiling should be returned
unit - rounding unit. Must be > 0.
Returns:
the ceiling value

floor

public static double floor(double x,
                           double unit)

Returns the largest double value that is smaller than the specified value and is equal to a multiple of the specified rounding unit. The java.lang.Math.floor implementation returns values that are multiples of integers only. It is equivalent to floor(x, 1). The following table provides some examples:

xunitfloor(x, unit)
13.260.113.2
13.26312
13261001300
-13.261-14

Parameters:
x - value whose ceiling should be returned
unit - rounding unit. Must be > 0.
Returns:
the ceiling value

median

public static double median(double[] list,
                            boolean sorted)
Returns the median of an array of double values. If the array contains an even number of elements, the median is computed as the arithmetic mean between the two middle elements.

Parameters:
list - array of double values
sorted - true if the array is already sorted in ascending numeric order. If false, the array will be sorted in place before computing the median.
Returns:
the median of the array elements

median

public static java.lang.Double median(java.util.List<java.lang.Double> list,
                                      boolean sorted)
Returns the median of a List array of Double values. If the list contains an even number of elements, the median is computed as the arithmetic mean between the two middle elements.

Parameters:
list - List of Double values
sorted - true if the list is already sorted in ascending numeric order. If false, the list will be sorted in place before computing the median.
Returns:
the median of the list elements
